content.description: Offering a brief section of fists and big-fists (off-width for wee folk), Walking Jack may leave you feeling like you've been kicked in the leg. For those accustomed to wide cracks there is a second, thinner crux awaiting them high on the route. Rarely led, despite excellent protection, this climb is often top-roped after leading Whisker Biscuit.
content.protection: Doubles of 1/2" through 3" including one 3.5" piece. Stoppers are also useful.
content.location: Walking Jack faces east and is located about 40 ft. right of Whisker Biscuit. Look for a 3.5" crack leading towards a large wedged block about 30' up.

content.description: Named after an especially fierce dog named Sequoia, this climb is tame in comparison. What appears from the ground to be a skin-eating offwidth replete with loose blocks is actually an enjoyable outing on mostly solid rock.  After an opening moves crux that serves up the only mandatory OW moves on the pitch, Quoia the Destroya offers fun, steep moves on solidly wedged flakes. After about 50' make an exposed move left under the bulge (blue camalot helpful) and follow the left-leaning crack to a ledge and the anchor for I Be Jammin'.
content.protection: A single set of cams from 1/2" to 4". A #5 and #6 Camalot are optional for those uncomfortable with a little distance between pieces.
content.location: Quoia the Destroya starts immediately to the right of I Be Jammin'. Look for the wide crack behind the pine tree. Please be mindful of the erosion prone base to this route and pitch in by moving rocks and helping to stabilize the area. Thanks!

content.description:
With a combination of thin, balancy crack climbing, featured slab and exposed knob pulling O.U.L.D. is a climb not to be missed.

The fun, bolted 5.9 slab warms you up and leads to the shallow corner that makes for the crux of the climb. Utilizing small cams and wires (RP's helpful but not necessary) carefully work your way up the beautiful tips/finger crack to a rest. Shake out and  continue straight up the finger crack past some small bushes. Move left to a left trending flake peppered with knobs and pull onto the ledge to a three bolt rap station.

O.U.L.D. is an acronym for Only Users Lose Drugs.
content.protection:
Thin pro is required. Small wires, doubles of cams from 3/8" to 2" and one 3" and 4" cam are helpful.

Bring draws for the bolted slab at the start.
content.location: O.U.L.D. is found at the center of the 2nd alcove to the left of We Be Jammin', right of Walking Jack. An obvious line.

content.description:
This is an alternate, and easier, start to Ears To You. It offers fun, well-protected face climbing and  a direct passage to the "Ear".

Start with bouldery moves on good edges in flakey rock. Although the surrounding rock is a bit chossy the holds are solid horizontal intrusions (iron-diorite?) and bomber. Place a good small cam and climb up to improving rock via intriguing moves. Another small cam placement in an overlap protects face moves that lead to a bolt. Clip the bolt and move up to the base of the "Ear". Finish on Ears To You.
content.protection: Two small cams (purple metolius) protect the first 15'-20'. The dihedral up higher takes wires and cams to 4". A single set should suffice for most. Two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Find Just Face It about twenty feet to the left of Ears to You. The start is marked by two (very) thin horizontal bands of dark rock. Look for a cairn at the base.

content.description:
An excellent crack line on the right side of the 2nd alcove.  An awkward crux with a wide crack which can be stemmed around down low is protected well with a 4" piece.  Continue to the awesome hand crack in the corner above.  A second crux is encountered near the top.

This is rated 5.10a in my old guide, but I found it to be quite easy for the grade.  5.9 is more accurate.
content.protection: 1-2 each .75-3" cams, 4" for the start.  Bolted anchor.
content.location: The right side of the 2nd alcove, just left of a medium sized pine tree.

content.description:
With a difficult boulder start and an appealing crack line, Ears to You is a wonderful new addition to the 2nd Alcove at Woodfords.

The pitch starts with a powerful move protected by a bolt (originally by fixed wires) which leads to the crack. Follow the crack up to the base of the "Ear" and traverse left under the small roof. Continue up the crack (a bit flaky) and behind the flake until you gain the top of the feature. Clip another bolt and face climb to the chain anchor.

This climb can also be led at 5.10b A0 by pulling on the first bolt.
content.protection: Double set of cams to 3". A 4" piece is also helpful. Bring draws for the bolts and shoulder slings to reduce rope drag.
content.location: Ears to You is located at the far right end of the 2nd Alcove, right of Quoia the Destroya. Look for the Ear-like feature with chains at the top.

content.description: Head up slightly flaring cracks to eventually end to the right of Walking Jack, traverse over to that anchor. A good warmup for the alcove.
content.protection: 1-2 each of #0.5 through #3 cams. Traverse left to Walking Jack anchor and lower/rappel from there.
content.location: Located generally in the left-hand corner of the second alcove when viewed from the approach trail. Take the crack system just to the right of Walking Jack.

content.description: Fun new route with fingers to squeeze chimney. The crux is probably the slanting offwidth in the middle, but fear not, there are holds and great jams.
content.protection: 1-2 each of #0.3 through #4 cams, 1 each of #5 and #6. Brand new bolted anchors up top ready for rappelling and TR. You could reach the anchors to toprope by leading I Be Jammin and heading up and left from those anchors. Bring a 70-meter rope as we believe a 60 would be short.
content.location: Located in the far right corner of the Second Alcove. Start near the tree (which is also at the base of I Be Jammin and Sequoia the Destroya), scramble ~20 feet up the easy corner, then step right into two parallel finger/thin hands cracks. Move up these cracks until you meet the obvious left trending hands to offwidth, and finally finish up the squeeze chimney
